summary: This document is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to UMB Bank, NA, demanding extensive financial records related to Ghislaine Maxwell for the period from January 1, 2005, to the present. It includes a request for non-disclosure to preserve the confidentiality of the ongoing criminal investigation into suspected felonies including sex trafficking and related offenses.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Issued and signed the grand jury subpoena as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The individual whose financial records are being subpoenaed from UMB Bank as part of a grand jury investigation into federal criminal law violations.

persons.name: MMI
persons.context: Signed the subpoena and is the point of contact for the production of records; also referenced in the Declaration of Custodian of Records.

connections.description: Berman is the United States Attorney and MMI is an Assistant United States Attorney in the same office, both involved in issuing the subpoena.
Berman's office is conducting a grand jury investigation into Maxwell, leading to the subpoena for her financial records.
AUSA MMI is directly handling the subpoena for Maxwell's financial records as part of the investigation.

events.title: Issuance of Grand Jury Subpoena
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the SDNY issues a grand jury subpoena to UMB Bank for Ghislaine Maxwell's financial records.

events.title: Scheduled Grand Jury Appearance
events.description: The subpoena commands UMB Bank to appear before the grand jury to testify and produce records, though appearance can be waived if records are produced by this date.

locations: UMB Bank, NA, 1010 Grand Boulevard, Kansas City, MO 64106
United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Manhattan, New York, NY
U.S. Attorney's Office, Southern District of New York, 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
The Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The subpoena seeks extensive financial records from UMB Bank for Ghislaine Maxwell from January 1, 2005, to the present, indicating a broad investigation into her financial activities.

The investigation involves alleged violations of federal criminal laws including sex trafficking (18 U.S.C. ยง 1591), conspiracy to commit sex trafficking (ยง 1594(c)), coercion and enticement (ยง 2422(b)), and conspiracy (ยง 371).
The government explicitly requests UMB Bank not to disclose the existence of the subpoena to any third party to preserve the confidentiality of the ongoing grand jury investigation.
The document reveals the ongoing and active nature of the federal investigation into Ghislaine Maxwell as of May 2020, several months before her arrest in July 2020.

The requested records cover a wide range of financial documents including account statements, signature cards, wire transfers, loan files, safe deposit records, and correspondence related to the accounts.
